Bay Area Open Science Group

A virtual community for Stanford, UCSF, UC Berkeley and beyond

2022-2023 Meetings

Date Title Presenter Summary
8/23/22 Open Science
Team Agreements		 BAOSG Facilitators Open Science Team Agreements Template discussion and incorporation of feedback from attendees
9/27/22 #FOAMed (Free Open Access Medical education) Dana Larsen (UCSF) Innovations in open curriculum for nephrology students
10/25/22 NASA TOPS (Transform to Open Science) Curriculum Development Natasha Batalha (NASA Ames) An introduction to the development of an open science curriculum as part of the NASA TOPS initiative for the 2023 Year of Open Science
11/29/22 Federal Open Science Policies BAOSG Facilitators Review of the 2023 NIH Data Management and Sharing Policy and the 2023 OSTP Memo
2/28/23 Project TARA (Tools to Advance Research Assessment), Building Blocks for Impact Ruth Schmidt (Institute of Design, Illinois Tech) Discussion of assessing impactful research through an open science lens.
3/28/23 Open and Reproducible Science at Stanford Joshua Buckholtz (Stanford) Discussion of the intersection of DEI and Open Science principles and practices.
4/25/23 Open Science in Bioengineering with the Fraser Lab Robbie Diaz and Christian Macdonald (UCSF) Discussion of the culture of Open Science in the Fraser Lab, the opportunities it has presented and impact it has had on members.
5/23/23 Open Data Steve Diggs
(UC California Digital Library)		 Discussion of data activism, data loss, and the four steps in data publishing.
6/27/23 ChatGPT and SciHub, an informal chat BAOSG + Albert Lee (UCSF) Discussion on the intersections between ChatGPT and SciHub and how researchers use them to find information.
